title.en: Introduction to Telecommunications: A Beginner's Guide

summary.en: A comprehensive theoretical and practical introduction to modern telecommunication systems.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • The fundamentals of communication engineering and its importance
  • The history and evolution of communication systems
  • Types of communication networks (wired and wireless)
  • Key concepts in signals and systems
  • Time and frequency domain analysis
  • Types of filters: Low Pass, High Pass, Band Pass, Band Stop
  • Fourier Series, Fourier Transform, Laplace Transform, Z-Transform
  • Analog modulation techniques (AM, FM, PM)
  • Digital modulation techniques (ASK, FSK, PSK, QAM)
  • Differences between analog and digital systems and communications
  • Analog to Digital Conversion (ADC) and Digital to Analog Conversion (DAC)
  • Sampling, quantization, encoding, PAM and PCM
  • Fundamentals of optical communications
  • Light sources, frequency bands, and light propagation
  • Optical fiber systems and applications
  • Satellite communication systems and applications
  • Error correction, encoding, and communication protocols

Course Content

6 sections โข 42 lectures โข Total length: 12h 59m

Requirements

  • Basic computer skills
  • Basic knowledge of mathematics (algebra, trigonometry, basic calculus)
  • Basic physics concepts related to waves and signals
  • No prior experience in communication engineering is required
  • Curiosity and interest in communication technologies

Description

This course provides a complete and detailed introduction to telecommunication engineering, combining strong theoretical foundations with practical concepts. It is designed for beginners, students, and aspiring engineers who want to understand how modern communication systems work and evolve.

The course starts with the fundamentals of telecommunications and their role in everyday life, followed by an in-depth exploration of communication networks, signals and systems, and mathematical tools used in signal analysis.

Students will gain a solid understanding of analog and digital modulation techniques, signal processing concepts, optical communication systems, and satellite communications. By the end of the course, learners will be well-prepared for advanced studies or professional careers in telecommunications, networking, and signal processing.

title.en: Introduction to the History of Telecommunications

summary.en: An introductory course that explains the fundamentals of telecommunication engineering, its role in daily life, and the historical evolution of communication systems.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course provides a beginner-friendly introduction to telecommunication engineering, covering its importance, real-life applications, and historical development.


๐ก Topics Covered

  • What is Telecommunication Engineering?

  • The Role of Telecommunication in Everyday Life

  • History of Telecommunication Systems

  • Communication Network Types and Applications

  • Digital Modulation (ASK, FSK, PSK, QAM)

summary.en: A fundamental course covering signals and systems concepts essential for telecommunication engineering students.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course introduces the core principles of signals and systems used in telecommunication engineering, with clear explanations and practical examples.


๐ก Topics Covered

  • What is a Signal & System

  • Classification of Signals

  • Operations on Signals

  • Elementary Signals

  • System Properties

  • Convolution

  • Signal Representation using Amplitude & Phase

  • Problem Solving

Course Videos

title.en: Fundamentals of Analog and Digital Communications

summary.en: A foundational course explaining analog and digital communication systems, conversion processes, and practical signal processing techniques.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course introduces the essential concepts of analog and digital communication systems with clear explanations and real engineering examples.


๐ก Topics Covered

  • Difference between Analog and Digital Systems

  • Analog to Digital Conversion (ADC)

  • Types of ADC Converters

  • Sampling Theory

  • Practical Sampling & PAM

  • PAM Demodulation & Quantization

  • Pulse Code Modulation (PCM)

  • Digital to Analog Conversion (DAC)

Course Videos

  • 24_The Difference between Analog and Digital Systems โ 26:30

  • 25_Analog to Digital Conversion (ADC) โ 10:20

  • 26_Types of ADC Converters โ 11:44

  • 27_Sampling โ 20:48

  • 28_Practical Sampling (PAM) โ 10:52

  • 29_PAM Demodulation & Quantization โ 10:11

  • 30_Encoding Pulse Code Modulation (PCM) โ 13:39

  • 31_Digital to Analog Conversion (DAC) โ 20:40

Watch the Course

summary.en: An introductory course covering the fundamentals of optical communication systems, fiber optics, and their applications.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course provides a clear and simple introduction to optical communications, suitable for both specialists and non-specialists.


๐ก Topics Covered

  • Introduction to Optical Communications

  • Optical Sources

  • Optical Fiber Medium

  • Types of Optical Detectors

  • Fundamentals of Light Propagation in Optical Fibers

  • Optical Communication Systems

  • Components of Optical Fiber Networks

  • Applications of Optical Fiber Communications

Watch the Course

summary.en: An introductory course covering the fundamentals of satellite communication systems, their components, modulation techniques, and applications.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course introduces satellite communication systems, suitable for both specialists and non-specialists.


๐ก Topics Covered

  • Introduction to Satellite Communications

  • Fundamentals of Satellite Communication Systems

  • Satellite Components Used in Communications

  • Frequency Bands and Modulation Techniques

  • Error Correction, Encoding, Communication Protocols, and Applications

Watch the Course

summary.en: Fundamentals of digital communication systems including sampling, quantization, PCM, and delta modulation.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Fundamentals of digital communications

  • The communication process and system elements

  • Modes of communication and communication channels

  • Sampling process in time and frequency domains

  • Pulse Amplitude Modulation (PAM)

  • Practical sampling techniques

  • Quantization concepts and types

  • Uniform quantizer characteristics

  • Quantization noise and SNR derivation

  • Pulse Code Modulation (PCM)

  • Elements of PCM systems

  • Encoding and line coding techniques

  • Delta Modulation (DM)

Course Content

  • Introduction to Digital Communications (52:19)

  • Quantization (1:01:29)

  • PCM โ Pulse Code Modulation (45:56)

  • Delta Modulation (37:40)

Description

This course provides a clear and practical introduction to digital communication systems. It focuses on the core concepts required to understand how digital information is transmitted efficiently and reliably.

Students will explore sampling, quantization, PAM, PCM, and delta modulation with practical explanations and problem-oriented discussions. This course is ideal for beginners and engineering students who want to build a strong foundation in digital communications.

Watch the Video

summary.en: Learn the core concepts of microprocessors, microcontrollers, and assembly programming for digital systems.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Comparison between microprocessor, microcontroller, and microcomputer

  • Definitions, components, uses, memory, cost, and power consumption

  • Programming and development basics

  • Real-time performance and practical examples

  • Instruction fetch and execute cycle

  • Microprocessor unit (MPU), program counter, and instruction decoder

  • Memory and instruction cycle with sample programs

  • Introduction to assembly language and its applications

  • Comparison between assembly and high-level languages

  • Integer storage, signed integers, two's complement, and conversions

  • Fundamentals of microprocessor design: CISC vs RISC, pipelined execution, superscalar architecture

  • Registers, flags, integer and character constants

Course Content

  • 1_Introduction (43:22)

  • 2_Instruction Fetch and Execute Cycle (58:07)

  • 3_Introduction to Assembly Language (31:34)

  • 4_Fundamentals of Microprocessor Design (40:02)

  • 5_Fundamentals of Assembly Language (45:57)

Description

This course provides a practical and detailed introduction to microprocessors, microcontrollers, and assembly programming. Students will explore system components, instruction cycles, and programming essentials with real-world examples.

By the end of the course, learners will have a solid understanding of microprocessor architecture, instruction execution, and assembly language programming, preparing them for digital system design and embedded programming.

Video

summary.en: Learn C++ programming basics, data types, operators, control structures, loops, and functions.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Programming basics and problem-solving approaches

  • Algorithm design and flowcharts

  • Basic definitions and computer system overview

  • Writing your first program in C++

  • C++ data types and primitive types

  • Operators: increment/decrement, assignment, relational

  • Conditional statements: if, switch

  • Loops: for, while, do/while

  • Functions in C++

Course Content

  • 1_Introduction (40:40)

  • 2_C++ Data Type (40:46)

  • 3_C++ Operators (41:18)

  • 4_Looping and Conditional Statements in C++ (1:01:37)

  • 5_Functions in C++ (36:47)

Description

This course provides a step-by-step introduction to programming using C++. Students will start from the basics of problem analysis and algorithm design, and gradually explore data types, operators, control structures, loops, and functions.

By the end of this course, learners will be able to write simple C++ programs, understand the core concepts of programming, and build a strong foundation for advanced topics.

Watch the Video

summary.en: Basic electronic circuits covering semiconductors, diodes, transistors, MOSFETs, op-amps, and power amplifiers.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Introduction to semiconductors, N-type & P-type

  • Diode (PN-Junction) concepts, forward/reverse bias, importance

  • Bipolar Junction Transistors (BJT): structure, operation, characteristics, modes, examples

  • MOSFETs: working principle, types, modes, characteristics, examples

  • Operational Amplifiers (Op-Amps): definition, symbol, practical model, ideal OP-AMPs, inverting/non-inverting amplifier, summing amplifier, difference amplifier, voltage follower

  • Power Amplifiers: definition, classification, classes, summary, Class A amplifier examples

Course Content

  • 1_Introduction: N-type & P-type Semiconductor, Diode (PN-Junction) (53:06)

  • 2_BJT Bipolar Junction Transistor (1:12:29)

  • 3_MOSFET (Metal Oxide Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor) (1:03:14)

  • 4_Operational Amplifiers Op Amp (57:06)

  • 5_Power Amplifiers (53:39)

Description

This course provides simple but clear coverage of basic electronic circuits to get started on a solid foundation in electronics. Topics include semiconductors, diodes, transistors, MOSFETs, operational amplifiers, and power amplifiers with practical explanations.

By the end of this course, students will understand the basic components and principles of electronic circuits, preparing them for more advanced studies in electronics and electrical engineering.

Watch the Video

summary.en: A practical introduction to computer organization, architecture, embedded systems, and assembly language programming.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Basics of computer organization and architecture

  • Definition of computer architecture vs organization, examples of attributes, structure and functions, main components, Von Neumann model, instruction cycle

  • IAS Computer overview and registers in the processor

  • Computer performance, buses inside CPUs, speeding up computers

  • Introduction to embedded systems, microcontroller vs microprocessor

  • Introduction to assembly language programming, basic instructions and structure

  • JUMP, LOOP, CALL instructions, assembly mnemonics, stack and RAM structure

Course Content

  • 1_Computer organization (Computer organization basics) (42:48)

  • 2_IAS Computer (48:45)

  • 3_Computer Performance & Introduction to Embedded System (1:05:58)

  • 4_Introduction to Assembly language programming (1:03:11)

  • 5_JUMPs & LOOPs & CALL & Assembly mnemonics & STACK RAM Structure (1:07:21)

Description

This course gives students a solid understanding of computer organization and architecture, covering embedded systems, assembly programming, and processor operation.

Students will learn about computer structure, instruction cycles, assembly language instructions, and embedded systems fundamentals with practical examples and explanations.

Watch the Video

summary.en: An in-depth introduction to digital control systems, covering ADC/DAC, sampling, Nyquist rate, frequency response, and state-space methods.

description.en:
What you'll learn

  • Basics of analog-to-digital conversion and digital control systems

  • Advantages and disadvantages of digital systems

  • A/D and D/A converters, hold circuits, and impulse sampling

  • Sampling process, Nyquist rate, impulse response, and frequency response

  • Bode plot and frequency analysis of systems

  • State-space concepts, components, and importance

  • Problem-solving using sampling, frequency response, and state-space techniques

  • State-space block diagrams and mechanical networks

  • Using semilog graph paper for analysis

Course Content

  • 1_Introduction (Analog to Digital Conversion Basics) (50:02)

  • 2_Sampling, Nyquist rate, Impulse Response, and Frequency Response (1:01:33)

  • 3_Frequency Response (Bode plot) (22:56)

  • 4_State Space (32:08)

  • 5_Section problems (1:00:48)

  • 6_State Space (Block Diagram & Mechanical Network) (41:52)

  • 7_Semilog Graph Paper (1:28:27)

Description

This course introduces the fundamentals of digital control systems with a practical approach. Students will understand sampling, ADC/DAC, Nyquist criteria, frequency response, Bode plots, and state-space analysis.

Practical examples and problem-solving exercises help learners apply digital control concepts and design systems effectively.

Watch the Video

summary.en: Comprehensive statistics course for nursing, covering central tendency, correlation coefficients, and frequency distributions.

description.en:
Course Overview

This course introduces the basics of statistics relevant to nursing, focusing on practical understanding of data analysis in healthcare settings.


๐ Topics Covered

  • Measures of Central Tendency: Mode, Mean, Median, Range, Variance, Standard Deviation

  • Frequency Distribution Creation

  • Pearson Correlation Coefficient

  • Spearman Correlation Coefficient

  • Ranking: Rank (x) and Rank (y)

Course Videos

  • 1_Basics of Statistics (Nursing) โ 1:05:02

  • 2_Basics of Statistics (Nursing) โ 1:12:53

Watch the Course

summary.en: Presentation on early detection of plant diseases using deep learning, including experiments, results, and project links.

description.en:
๐ฑ Graduation Project: โRevolutionizing Disease Detectionโ

One of the most exciting aspects of the course was the final project, which focused on early detection of plant diseases using deep learning.


๐ Dataset

  • Over 3GB of data

  • 70,000+ training images

  • 14,000+ testing images

  • Managed via Kaggle

๐ง Experiments & Results

We evaluated several deep learning models, including traditional CNNs and ResNet50. The best performance was achieved using InceptionResNet V2, reaching over 96% accuracy with minimal loss.

We further improved the model by customizing and retraining it for enhanced results.

๐ We visualized and compared model performances to clearly understand the improvements and trade-offs and developed a final improved version for real-world application.


๐ Graduation Project Links

  • Presentation: https://lnkd.in/dmX6kr93

  • GitHub Repository: https://lnkd.in/dABnbnAS

  • Kaggle Models: https://lnkd.in/dnw6ixcw, https://lnkd.in/dBZQd2RP, https://lnkd.in/dnkavziz

  • PDF Report: https://lnkd.in/drSziKnV

Watch the Presentation

summary.en: An introduction to 5G technology and its integration with computer networks, mobile communications, and optical systems.

description.en:
Key Topics:

  • Optical Communication Systems: WDM reconfiguration, CWDM, DWDM, components and technologies supporting 5G

  • 5G Technology Overview: Increased capacity, speed, global standards, and challenges

  • Impact on Computer Network Architecture: Integration with networks and mobile communication systems

Videos in this Seminar

  • Optical Communication Systems: Reconfiguration of WDM optical network with support to 5G โ 42:52

  • Computer Communication Networks: 5G technology and its impact on Computer network architecture โ 23:55

Watch the Seminar

title.en: Full Mobile App Experience โ Graduation Project

summary.en: Practical demonstration of a smart irrigation system and AI-based plant disease detection mobile app using Flutter & ESP32.

description.en:
Key Topics:

  • Sensors & Microcontroller โ ESP32, Soil moisture, Water level, DHT22, DC Motor, Relay Module, LCD 16*2
  • Firebase & FireStore โ IoT, Cloud, Database, Hosting, Authentication
  • Full in-app AI experience โ Chat with AI, Identify plant diseases using AI (Gemini AI)
  • Full mobile app experience โ Account creation & login, sensor monitoring, AI chat & image, cloud, database, mobile app using Flutter & FlutterFlow
  • Smart Irrigation System โ Final practical application
  • Create & Login Account โ Authentication, Dark & Light Mode, Arabic & English

Watch the Video

summary.en: Get full access to the 'Telecommunication Fundamentals' course for free using the code below. Limited time offer!

description.en:
Course Highlights:

  • Understanding the basics of telecommunications: definition, importance, historical evolution.
  • Types of networks and systems: wired vs wireless, applications in healthcare, transport, entertainment.
  • Core theoretical concepts: signals, systems, Fourier and Laplace transforms, bandwidth, filtering, noise reduction.
  • Modulation and signal processing: Analog and Digital modulation techniques, effective and reliable signal transmission.
  • Transition from analog to digital systems: Sampling theorem, analog-to-digital conversion.
  • Practical applications and preparing for the future: modern infrastructure devices and technologies.

Use code 72125FF8685053908F06 at checkout. Limited spots!
